channel.title: Moderators
channel.description:
Is it just me, or have I noticed a great decrease in the moderator activity :|
Did they go on vacation?
Quit?
Just not being active?
Am I going crazy?
OR DID THEY ALL GET LAID AND DITCH US!
COME BACK MSCP MODERATORS, WE <3 AND MISS YOU!

item.title: Moderators
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

I don’t care what you call it, you get the idea

Read full topic

item.title: Moderators
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

Reyx, just to point out, quality assurance is for marketing companies. It’s the stupidest idea for implementing it to a forum that doesn’t even sell anything.

(Which is why Wade is stupid)

Read full topic

item.title: Moderators
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

Which is where the QA team would play in.

Read full topic

item.title: Moderators
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Jc22493:

Let’s just report whatever we deem needs to be and the staff members will deal with it. Much simpler, imo.

To a point yes, but it would be nice to have a backup system once in a while.

Read full topic

item.title: Moderators
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Let’s just report whatever we deem needs to be and the staff members will deal with it. Much simpler, imo.

item.title: Moderators
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:43, topic:386159”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=481917.msg3530800#msg3530800 date=1300147416]
Ok, how about my original system. However, MITB or some mods could have some pre approved quality assurance people (sorry Corey).
Once the 10 votes are submitted, it is sent to all online approved people, and atleast 33% must agree to remove it. If non are online, all on that list receive it, and the first 1/5 of those members votes on the removal of the topic are the ones that affect the final decision.
[/quote]That’s basically exactly the system we have now; with the quality assurance people being mods[/quote]

Mods can automatically do that though without the whole voting system. This is just a slower process.

Read full topic

If non are online, all on that list receive it, and the first 1/5 of those members votes on the removal of the topic are the ones that affect the final decision.[/quote]That’s basically exactly the system we have now; with the quality assurance people being mods

item.title: Moderators
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:40, topic:386159”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=481917.msg3530784#msg3530784 date=1300146632]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=481917.msg3530779#msg3530779 date=1300146535]

Maybe if a post / topic gets 10 “report to moderator”, it will auto b removed? And only 1 vote per person, obviously
[/quote]In theory it’s a good idea, but when you think about larger topics (say, IRL picture threads) it’s way too easy to abuse =/

We could write an equation based off of views and comments
[/quote]That might work…[/quote]
No it wouldn’t, as spam is considered a comment too.

Read full topic

item.title: Moderators
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

[quote=“TOMSCAPE BETA, post:34, topic:386159”][quote author=Jc22493 link=topic=481917.msg3530528#msg3530528 date=1300134094]

At first I thought the same thing, but Mopar’s right, most of it is gone before we see it. When Obamabinlaffen’s posted them threads there was no mods online at that time. Which is bound to happen at some point in the day - a carefully planned out attack I suppose. Still fail.

I believe I was on and off all morning and I deleted his posts and banned him as soon as I noticed. I always keep my online status hidden.

But I don’t see the problem here really. I hope you guys can handle some spam for a while and just ignore it. It’s not like it will go unnoticed by the mods forever.

  • it would help if we reported members/threads. (…which I do, ofc.)
    [/quote]

I’d have to agree, once a thread is reported it tends to get dealt with pretty fast. The only issue is, when I see a thread which breaks the rules I just report it. Many other members just contribute to the rule breaking and leave negative comments - then don’t report it.

I think people see a bad thread as an opportunity to make them selves look ‘cool’.[/quote]
This.
If I remember and memory serves me right, I do believe that it’s against the Rules to post on a thread after reporting it or it being bad or something like that.

Read full topic

item.title: Moderators
item.dc:creator: @asyo4 asyo4
item.description:
@asyo4 wrote:

[quote=“TOMSCAPE BETA, post:34, topic:386159”][quote author=Jc22493 link=topic=481917.msg3530528#msg3530528 date=1300134094]

At first I thought the same thing, but Mopar’s right, most of it is gone before we see it. When Obamabinlaffen’s posted them threads there was no mods online at that time. Which is bound to happen at some point in the day - a carefully planned out attack I suppose. Still fail.

I believe I was on and off all morning and I deleted his posts and banned him as soon as I noticed. I always keep my online status hidden.

But I don’t see the problem here really. I hope you guys can handle some spam for a while and just ignore it. It’s not like it will go unnoticed by the mods forever.

  • it would help if we reported members/threads. (…which I do, ofc.)
    [/quote]

I’d have to agree, once a thread is reported it tends to get dealt with pretty fast. The only issue is, when I see a thread which breaks the rules I just report it. Many other members just contribute to the rule breaking and leave negative comments - then don’t report it.

I think people see a bad thread as an opportunity to make them selves look ‘cool’.[/quote]

item.title: Moderators
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

[quote=“Jc22493, post:33, topic:386159”][quote author=jme link=topic=481917.msg3530521#msg3530521 date=1300133978]

At first I thought the same thing, but Mopar’s right, most of it is gone before we see it. When Obamabinlaffen’s posted them threads there was no mods online at that time. Which is bound to happen at some point in the day - a carefully planned out attack I suppose. Still fail.

I believe I was on and off all morning and I deleted his posts and banned him as soon as I noticed. I always keep my online status hidden.

But I don’t see the problem here really. I hope you guys can handle some spam for a while and just ignore it. It’s not like it will go unnoticed by the mods forever.
[/quote]

  • it would help if we reported members/threads. (…which I do, ofc.)[/quote]

I’d have to agree, once a thread is reported it tends to get dealt with pretty fast. The only issue is, when I see a thread which breaks the rules I just report it. Many other members just contribute to the rule breaking and leave negative comments - then don’t report it.

I think people see a bad thread as an opportunity to make them selves look ‘cool’.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Miss Silabsoft:

I already locked my one topic for the month so Ill let this one stay open

Had to get the quota in. I think the moderators are active, just lurking is all. No needs to worry.

item.title: Moderators
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

[quote=“Newty, post:25, topic:386159”]Sorry guys

I’m especially sorry to cane and tom (and fc :p) as I can’t seem to find the time for the IRC.

</3[/quote]

It’s nice to know you’re still with us.

A lot of people have been looking for you, Cane especially regarding your community. Just thought I’d give you the heads up.

Read full topic

item.title: Moderators
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Many moderators become inactive once they become promoted for some reason. The site seems to be doing better though, in terms of the threads that are created.

Read full topic

item.title: Moderators
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

Andrew Ferguson:

You may think that they aren’t doing that much but thats because they catch things ahead of time, without them there will be at least 50 rule breaking threads a day still live on the site. Just cause some of them have a life doesn’t mean you should create a whole topic to rant on them.

What the hell? Where in my post did I say that they didn’t do much? All I stated was that I haven’t seen them as active as they usually are. It doesn’t mean they aren’t active, it just means I haven’t seen them as active.
Also I wasn’t ranting, I was asking a question.

Read full topic

item.title: Moderators
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

We’re not blaming you for anything. I am pretty sure the moderators work hard to keep the site as clean as possible. Nevertheless, it’s only to be expected people (me) get annoyed when they report topics and they time time to get deleted/removed

Read full topic

item.title: Moderators

item.description:

Sorry guys

I’m especially sorry to cane and tom (and fc :p) as I can’t seem to find the time for the IRC.

</3
